dismissalText.long: c Mushfiqur Rahim b Taskin Ahmed
dismissalText.commentary: Janneman Malan c Mushfiqur Rahim b Taskin Ahmed 39 (56b 7x4 0x6 68m) SR: 69.64

dismissalComment.html: edged behind, another one falls! Just the perfect bounce and movement for Taskin to have a say. This ball was a lot shorter around fifth stump, and a change up from the pretty full lengths he had been bowling this over. Malan walked down the pitch for a few steps, and went to tickle at that ball away from his body. But there was some extra bounce for Taskin there, along with some movement away from him, as the ball took Malan's top edge and went right into Mushfiq's gloves

dismissalText.long: run out (Tamim Iqbal/Mushfiqur Rahim)
dismissalText.commentary: Keshav Maharaj run out (Tamim Iqbal/Mushfiqur Rahim) 28 (39b 4x4 0x6 62m) SR: 71.79

dismissalComment.html: An absolute mess! It's nudged towards point and there was no chance of a run. A desperate attempt at a single and the keeper whips off the bails with glee

dismissalComment.html: A bonus for Bangladesh! An arguably poor delivery from Taskin, who sends it short and wide, but it catches Verreynne's bottom edge and he drags it back onto his stumps!

image.longCaption: Janneman Malan portrait, November 19, 2020

headshotImage.caption: Janneman Malan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Janneman Malan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: edged behind, another one falls! Just the perfect bounce and movement for Taskin to have a say. This ball was a lot shorter around fifth stump, and a change up from the pretty full lengths he had been bowling this over. Malan walked down the pitch for a few steps, and went to tickle at that ball away from his body. But there was some extra bounce for Taskin there, along with some movement away from him, as the ball took Malan's top edge and went right into Mushfiq's gloves

image.caption: Dwaine Pretorius portrait
image.longCaption: Dwaine Pretorius portrait, November 19, 2020

headshotImage.caption: Dwaine Pretorius player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dwaine Pretorius player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: another outside edge, and another one gone! Taskin on a roll, he is leading Bangladesh all the way. Pretorius has a Sehwag-like slash away from his body, and ends up tickling it to the keeper. Back of a length ball from Taskin, and around sixth stump - or possibly even further - as Pretorius tries to slash at that with barely any foot movement forward. He ends up being beaten by the extra bounce - that weapon again - as the ball takes the outside edge to the keeper

image.caption: David Miller portrait
image.longCaption: David Miller portrait, November 19, 2020

headshotImage.caption: DA Miller headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: DA Miller headshot

dismissalComment.html: Miller is gone! Taskin with another wicket, as he sends in a short-ish ball right into Miller's hips. The batter can only nick it to the keeper as Bangladesh celebrate wildly!

image.caption: Kagiso Rabada portrait
image.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada portrait, November 19, 2020

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: GOT HIM! TASKIN HAS FIVE! Another beauty from Taskin, fuller, in the slot outside off, tempting Rabada into the drive and he can only succeed in edging it to the keeper. Magnificent. Hang on! The umpires are reviewing the catch, but Mushfiqur collected it safely, despite the ball dying down in front of him. It's out!

image.longCaption: Temba Bavuma portrait, November 26, 2020

headshotImage.caption: Temba Bavuma player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Temba Bavuma player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: very confident appeal for leg before, and given! Bavuma and VDD have a word, and Bavuma reviews. Looked out to the naked eye though, but who knows? Fullish ball on middle, and going on with the angle. Bavuma is down on his back knee early to try and sweep, as the ball strikes his back thigh while he misses the stroke. And replays confirm umpire's call on clipping leg stump. South Africa slide into further trouble

image.caption: Lungi Ngidi portrait
image.longCaption: Lungi Ngidi portrait, November 19, 2020

headshotImage.caption: Lungi Ngidi player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lungi Ngidi player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Ngidi's gone! Tossed up by Shakib and Ngidi dances down, aiming to clip it down towards leg. It takes a leading edge and the ball flies high up into the air, with the fielder at mid off taking a well judged catch, diving to collect the ball

dismissalText.long: c Mehidy Hasan Miraz b Shoriful Islam
dismissalText.commentary: Rassie van der Dussen c Mehidy Hasan Miraz b Shoriful Islam 4 (10b 0x4 0x6 17m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: gone! Extra bounce again, and another one departs! Taken at point. Bangladesh have sent back half the South Africa side into the pavilion inside 19 overs after they chose to bat. Good length ball just outside off, as VDD closes the bat face to try and clip to the on side. But the ball lifts off the surface as abruptly as the wind picking up speed, and takes off from nearly off the shoulder of the bat. South Africa in a hole

commentTextItems.html: It's over! A stunning result! Bangladesh win an ODI series in South Africa for the first time. Short, outside off, and Shakib Al Hasan has the honour! He cuts it away behind point for a four.

commentPostTextItems.html: With that historic win, we wrap up the ODI leg of the tour. It has gone 2-1 to Bangladesh, as two WTC Tests follow next week. Until then, it is goodnight and goodbye from Binoy, Himanshu and Sunaadh!

Robert: "It is almost poetic that Shakib Al Hasan scores the winning runs, after what must have felt like a fortnight from hell for him. What a fighter Shakib Al Hasan is, truly the greatest Cricketer Bangladesh will ever likely produce"
Tahmid: "It's hard to imagine the aggression Taskin brings on the pitch after watching him speaking in the presentation and smiling from one ear to another"
With that, Tamim calls upon his team-mates to rejoice and lift the trophy.

Tamim Iqbal, the winning captain: "I am a very proud man, especially with a Bangladeshi fast bowler getting a five-for, winning the series [for us] and winning the Player of the Series award. The coaches - even past coaches - have done a tremendous job. This is massive. It is a massive achievement for us seniors. I will rate this at the top. When we are touring, we can win games and series. We take of a lot of pride in ODI cricket. This is one format where we are very comfortable. The missing part was winning overseas, and we somehow did that this series. For Shakib to come and play here was massive. His daughters, his mother and his mother-in-law are in hospital. That shows his character. This feels like mini-Dhaka to be honest. The fans have been brilliant. As Russell, our head coach, says, they are our 12th men. They are always there. [Plans for the Test series] Give me a break, I am not the Test captain! I am sure we would like to do well."

Temba Bavuma, the host captain: "For me, the Bangladeshis were the better outfit. They showed us how to play. You saw how clinical they were with the bat. We were completely outplayed in this series. That's the question I have been asking myself [as to how they beat India 2-0 but lost 2-1 to Bangladesh]. In this three-match series, we certainly weren't good enough. Guys individually will know [if IPL distracted them]. They have to ask themselves, but that is not an excuse. The Super League becomes a talking point. We need to qualify for the World Cup. We have taken a couple of steps back in this series after taking steps forward against India. We still have the opportunity to get those points."

Taskin Ahmed is both the Player of the Match and the Player of the Series. He speaks while barely being able to manage the weight of both the awards: "Feeling happy and proud. This is first time for me [getting] the Player of the Series [award]. For the last one-and-half and two years, I have been following the same process. In every match, my captain always supports me, and gives me a clear role: to be fast and aggressive, and take wickets. I enjoyed a lot [here], and from when we have arrived, I have been working on my length. Just basics. I still have to learn how to get five wickets on a flat wicket."
Arun: "I'm not amazed at the result but I'm amazed at how Ban won. Watch out for the new world cup contender!"
Shahmir Haider: "What a day for visiting teams! Both the fortresses Lahore and Centurion conquered!"
A supreme performance from Bangladesh, who win their first ever series in South Africa. Stick around for the presentations.

Taskin Ahmed started things off with a stunning bowling performance, taking 5-35 as the visitors whittled out their hosts for a paltry 154. South Africa struggled to get any sort of partnership together, as Bangladesh took advantage of the uneven bounce in the pitch to limit their opponents.

6.09pm Tamim Iqbal and Litton Das comfortably dealt with a supposedly difficult pitch, notching up a century stand. Litton well two short of a well-deserved half century, but Tamim Iqbal and Shakib Al Hasan had the honour of finishing things off in style, with the former racking up an undefeated 87*.

commentTextItems.html: Wide down the leg side. Bangladesh are getting closer...
Length, outside off and defended off the front foot towards cover

commentPreTextItems.html: Reza Rahman: "Taskin is my player of this series. What a performance!! Bangladesh fast bowler destroyed South Africa in South Africa!!! Unbelievable.." - He's certainly a leading candidate!

dismissalText.commentary: Janneman Malan c Mushfiqur Rahim b Taskin Ahmed 39 (56b 7x4 0x6 68m) SR: 69.64

dismissalComment.html: edged behind, another one falls! Just the perfect bounce and movement for Taskin to have a say. This ball was a lot shorter around fifth stump, and a change up from the pretty full lengths he had been bowling this over. Malan walked down the pitch for a few steps, and went to tickle at that ball away from his body. But there was some extra bounce for Taskin there, along with some movement away from him, as the ball took Malan's top edge and went right into Mushfiq's gloves

Fullish ball on middle, and going on with the angle. Bavuma is down on his back knee early to try and sweep, as the ball strikes his back thigh while he misses the stroke. And replays confirm umpire's call on clipping leg stump. South Africa slide into further trouble

dismissalComment.html: gone! Extra bounce again, and another one departs! Taken at point. Bangladesh have sent back half the South Africa side into the pavilion inside 19 overs after they chose to bat. Good length ball just outside off, as VDD closes the bat face to try and clip to the on side. But the ball lifts off the surface as abruptly as the wind picking up speed, and takes off from nearly off the shoulder of the bat. South Africa in a hole

Pretorius has a Sehwag-like slash away from his body, and ends up tickling it to the keeper. Back of a length ball from Taskin, and around sixth stump - or possibly even further - as Pretorius tries to slash at that with barely any foot movement forward. He ends up being beaten by the extra bounce - that weapon again - as the ball takes the outside edge to the keeper
